channel.title: [PI] problem.. [PI]
channel.description:
Hello, The solution to this problem has eluded me for nigh on a year and a bit now. *NOTHING* drops bones. I have the switch statement already coded into the NpcHandler, and it looks like this:
[code]public int boneDrop(int type) { switch (type) { case 1: case 9: case 100: case 12: case 17: case 803: case 18: case 81: case 101: case 41: case 19: case 90: case 75: case 86: case 78: case 912: case 913: case 914: case 1648: case 1643: case 1618: case 1624: case 181: case 119: case 49: case 26: case 1341: case 3247: case 6233: case 6232: case 3248: case 6212: case 6254: case 6258: return 526; case 117: case 6270: case 6269: case 4291: case 4292: return 532; case 50: case 53: case 54: case 55: case 941: case 1590: case 1591: case 1592: case 6218: case 6272: case 6274: return 536; case 84: case 1615: case 1613: case 82: case 3200: case 6208: case 6206: case 6204: case 6203: return 592; case 2881: case 2882: case 2883: return 6729; default: return 1; } }[/code] so please, what's the solution? everything I've checked seems to be in order, I haven't got any idea what I've missed. I'll show you any files you need to see in a reply.
Thanks for your time.

item.title: [PI] problem.. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @infallibl3 infallibl3
item.description:
@infallibl3 wrote:

Hello,
The solution to this problem has eluded me for nigh on a year and a bit now. NOTHING drops bones. I have the switch statement already coded into the NpcHandler, and it looks like this:

    [code]public int boneDrop(int type) {
            switch (type) {
                    case 1:
                    case 9:
                    case 100:
                    case 12:
                    case 17:
                    case 803:
                    case 18:
                    case 81:
                    case 101:
                    case 41:
                    case 19:
                    case 90:
                    case 75:
                    case 86:
                    case 78:
                    case 912:
                    case 913:
                    case 914:
                    case 1648:
                    case 1643:
                    case 1618:
                    case 1624:
                    case 181:
                    case 119:
                    case 49:
                    case 26:
                    case 1341:
                    case 3247:
                    case 6233:
                    case 6232:
                    case 3248:
                    case 6212:
                    case 6254:
                    case 6258:
                    return 526;
                    case 117:
                    case 6270:
                    case 6269:
                    case 4291:
                    case 4292:
                    return 532;
                    case 50:
                    case 53:
                    case 54:
                    case 55:
                    case 941:
                    case 1590:
                    case 1591:
                    case 1592:
                    case 6218:
                    case 6272:
                    case 6274:
                    return 536;
                    case 84:
                    case 1615:
                    case 1613:
                    case 82:
                    case 3200:
                    case 6208:
                    case 6206:
                    case 6204:
                    case 6203:
                    return 592;
                    case 2881:
                    case 2882:
                    case 2883:
                    return 6729;
                    default:
                    return 1;
            }       
    }[/code]

so please, what’s the solution? everything I’ve checked seems to be in order, I haven’t got any idea what I’ve missed. I’ll show you any files you need to see in a reply.

Thanks for your time.
